Review:
I have never purchased a George Foreman grill; the infomercials alone were enough to scare me off. When I moved into my apartment a few months back, I realized that my roommate, the consummate college student, had a George Foreman Next Generation grill that he never used, and I figured it was worth a shot. Maybe the former boxing champ slapped his name on something pretty stupendous, if it's been around this long, right? The result was less than stellar.

I bought a couple steaks as the first and final test of the product; it's hard to screw up a good steak, after all, so regardless of how hit-or-miss the product was, I'd still eat well. The George Foreman grill took a good 15 minutes to warm up, and went from "stone cold" to "nearly on fire" almost instantaneously after that. The steaks didn't cook evenly, the non-stick surface didn't, and cleaning the thing is a nightmare unto itself. I can see how a college kid would love this thing, and for that it's fantastic. As an actual kitchen appliance, it's a waste of forty dollars. Stick to the range-top and get better results.
Truth vs. Deception Judgments: [F, F, F, F, T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T]

Review: I'll sum it up in one word: SCAM. Those people you see on the infomercial making milkshakes and nacho cheese and soup and all that other jazz definitely aren't using the same blender that I bought. First off, the blender cups are like a tenth of the size of a regular blender. What if i want to have more than half of a cup of soup, or make a milkshake that can actually fill a regular-sized glass? The first time I did try to make a milkshake with it, I filled the cup pretty full, because the magic bullet is supposed to be strong enough to handle basically anything. Bull. The blades would hardly rotate, and I had to sit there pulsing it for an hour, just to end up with a grainy, soupy mess of a milkshake. Save yourself the disappointment and go buy a nice Oster brand blender. My buddy has one, and it beats the hell out of this crappy infomercial magic bullet.
Truth vs. Deception Judgments: [F, F, F, T, T, T, T, T, T, T]

Review: When our ten year old Mr. Coffee stopped working we naturally looked at similar replacements. Most had features and functions that we never used like brew strength, timers, auto brew and so on. We get up in the morning and make coffee, simple! This coffee maker fit the bill at a very attractive price. Just put in the water, filter and coffee and hit the switch! We did not pay for features that we never use, a difficult thing to do now that everything has a micro processor and is software driven. The coffee is great and the sleek black color scheme goes with any modern kitchen, stainless steel, chrome or black.

Review: I purchased the Stanley Bostitch QuietSharp Executive Electric Pencil Sharpener about 3 weeks ago. I needed something for when my kids were doing homework, as they always break the pencils. I chose this model, as it seemed to be middle of the line. Not too cheap, and not too expensive. We've had nothing but problems. You need to shove the pencil in and hold the back of the device just to reach the blades, it skips one whole side of the pencil tip so that only one side is sharpened which leaves you writing on wood instead of lead. And, it's NOT quiet! Next time I will spend more money on something more reliable. We have wasted too many pencils (and time) on this moedel. Do NOT buy it!

Review: We got stuck in Orlando Florida and the airline put us up in a Best Western. By the time we got to the hotel it was 2am, we were tired and cranky, and the male receptionist had sharpened his teeth and finger nails into a point -- very creepy. We we got to the room it appeared to not have been cleaned at all. The carpet was wet from the air conditioner to the front of the nearest bed, the lamp shades were bent/faded and there were used test strips on the desk -- looked like it was missed simply because the test strip was the same color of the desk. I took pictures and intended on e-mailing them and a complaint to the corporate office, but never got around to it. To make matters worse, we put the do not disturb sign on the door and the hotel staff knocked on the door at 9am, 10am and 11am wanting to clean the room --- our check out time wasn't until noon. I opened the door and gave a scolding look and said they were too late for cleaning.

Review: I purchased my first laser printer which was a Brothers brand from Best Buy. Setup of the printer was very easy and straight forward. I had the printer set up and running on my computer in about 5 minutes and it came with everything i needed to get started right away. The instruction manual was very easy to follow and answered all my questions. After i got the printer set up i completed a few printed test pages and was very happy with the speed of the printer. It only took a few seconds to print each page and the quality of the printing was very good. This printer had great resolution and even small text was easy to read and did not have any kind of blurriness or smudging. For the price i would recommend this printer to anyone who is looking for a laser printer.

Review:
I was looking for a cheap pair of headsets for my Nokia X1. My cellphone accepts standard 3.5mm plug. I was surfing through Amazon, and I found "Palm Stereo Headsets". I found its reviews very mouth watering, and the price was just unbeatable. (USD 3.5 at that time).

I ordered it without any reluctance, and now was the time I would wait for it to arrive. The delivery time was awesome.

When I received it, it had no packaging. Just a small foil. I guess buying a 3.5$ headsets compensates it.

It looked light quality, but I was astonished, the build was superb. Cosmetically, it looked no less than those Apple headsets. I plugged it into my Computer, and the sound was also good. Remember, they were just $3.5. The price is too good, and I would have ordered more, but the sale was over.

I'd give it :

Presentation : 3/5
Build Quality : 4.5/5
Sound Quality : 4.5/5
Durability : 4.5/5
Worth for money : 5/5

Overall : 4.3/5

Just a side note, my phone did NOT support it. Altough, the expensive sets I tried were supported. They should have mentioned it.
Truth vs. Deception Judgments: [F, F, F, F, F, T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T]

Review: The Kenmore Elite French-Door Bottom-Freezer Refrigerator is the worst! I had this refrigerator for just a little over a year, then all of the sudden, the temperature control goes all out of whack. If I turn the knob to the right just a little, all the food in my refrigerator is frozen, if I turn it to the left a little, food goes bad. I called Kenmore since my refrigerator is under warranty (or so I thought), and they said the part that I need is $250 plus $150 for the instillation. Turned out the compressor is only under warranty for 12 months, and I have had mine for 14 months. Why would you buy a refrigerator that last only a year? I am not impressed with Kenmore or their service at all!
